name: places/ChIJYaVdffBYwokRJSlAHoGvHWo
adrFormatAddress: 768 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019-1685, USA

editorialSummary.text: The Plaza hotel's on-site jazz joint, serving cocktails & gourmet light bites in a plush setting.

originalText.text: Given the pricing this is definitely best as an occasional treat, but they do a great job when the occasion is right. The service is excellent, the Wednesday jazz band is very talented, and the drinks are delicious. I've had Manhattans all over the city and I can honestly say their barrel-aged Manhattan is the best yet (as it should be for $27!). Knocked off one star as some of the furniture was showing some wear and my table was a little tippy, both things I consider a bit improper for such a high end venue.

originalText.text: At $25 per cocktail, few can afford the Rose Club as a regular hangout. But as an occasional treat, the experience is just that- a treat. Everything on their cocktail menu looks delicious (I enjoyed everything I've had immensely), further enhanced by the elegant atmosphere. I recommend going on Wednesday evenings between 9 and midnight, when the talented Kat Gang and her band serenades you with classic jazz as you sip on your classy cocktail. There is no cover for the show, so the value of your $25 drink skyrockets.

originalText.text: How can you not love the decadence of the Plaza and the elegance. I ordered the old fashioned and it was delicious, they also brought some small snack (peanuts), but the waiter did not check on us a lot. I guess that is okay because you want time to socialize and not be interrupted. But I also do not like to look around to ask for water. I would go back. Expect the drinks to be $25 a person, but it is the Plaza who cares. True NY experience and has to be done at least once in your life.

originalText.text: Exceptional venue & elegance....  Music is top notch and the food stellar as  in the Plaza. Yet, why oh why would the remodel take such classic elegance and convert it into an unconscionable pink calamity.  There are things in life that SIMPLY DON'T NEED TO IMPROVING, it should be returned to its original grace.

originalText.text: A classy little bar in The Plaza, excellent service and great ale, three philosophers I'd recommend. Also like to add they took off my mothers drink from bill, so a free drink for her 70th and a little cake they complement her with.
